intro: Niphobolus inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal niphobolus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and trifoliate leaves, which are compound and have three leaflets. Its flowers are small and clustered in racemes, typically appearing in shades of white or pale purple. Niphobolus inaequalis is often found in dry, open habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
